title: City news: HSBC, JCB, Finsbury, French Connection
text:
City news: HSBC, JCB, Finsbury, French Connection City news: HSBC, JCB, Finsbury, French Connection HSBC is banking on growth in China with plans to recruit 4,000 more staff there. PUBLISHED: PUBLISHED: 00:01, Tue, Sep 22, 2015 GETTY HSBC bank is expanding in China 
Europe’s biggest bank is shrinking its global workforce by up to 50,000 – half of them by selling businesses in Brazil and Turkey – to reduce costs and boost profits, but will expand in China’s Pearl River Delta region over the next three to four years. It is looking to increase its pre-tax profit there to $1billion within five years from $100million last year. HSBC, which is axing between 7,000 and 8,000 jobs in the UK or one in six of its staff here, is reviewing whether to remain domiciled in Britain or to move its headquarters to another part of the world, most likely Hong Kong.
